<title level="1" right="Focus 3" pfs="Standard">
[Delay Affliction](/Spells.aspx?ID=2082)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=721" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=623" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
<trait label="Oracle" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=319" />
<trait label="Vitality" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=509" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 260 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Mystery**
[Life](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=17)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

With a surge of healing energy, you push back against an affliction threatening the target and grant a small amount of healing. The target recovers 3d8 Hit Points. You attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) any one affliction you are aware the target has, suspending its effects for 1 hour on a success rather than removing it. The target is then temporarily immune to _delay affliction_ for 1 day. You don't need to have identified the name of the specific affliction, but you do need to be aware of it; for instance, you couldn't delay an [ingested](/Traits.aspx?ID=633) [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) during its onset period unless you were aware of the poison.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The target recovers an additional 1d8 Hit Points, and you can attempt to suspend an additional affliction.
name: Delay Affliction
